login_ref.Description: Login reference for token authentication (see BIG-IP REST docs for details)

password.Description: The user's password. Leave empty if using token_value

port.Description: Management Port to connect to Bigip

teem_disable.Description: If this flag set to true,sending telemetry data to TEEM will be disabled

token_auth.Description: Enable to use an external authentication source (LDAP, TACACS, etc)

token_value.Description: A token generated outside the provider, in place of password

username.Description: Username with API access to the BigIP

ignore_metadata.Description: Set True if you want to ignore metadata update

task_id.Description: ID of AS3 post declaration async task

tenant_name.Deprecated: this attribute is no longer in use

bigiq_address.Description: The registration key pool to use

bigiq_login_ref.Description: Login reference for token authentication (see BIG-IQ REST docs for details)

bigiq_password.Description: The registration key pool to use

bigiq_port.Description: The registration key pool to use

bigiq_token_auth.Description: Enable to use an external authentication source (LDAP, TACACS, etc)

bigiq_user.Description: The registration key pool to use

ignore_metadata.Description: Set True if you want to ignore metadata update

configsync_ip.Description: IP address used for config sync

mirror_ip.Description: IP address used for state mirroring

mirror_secondary_ip.Description: Secondary IP address used for state mirroring

name.Description: Address of the Device which needs to be Deviceensed

auto_sync.Description: Specifies if the device-group will automatically sync configuration data to its members

full_load_on_sync.Description: Specifies if the device-group will perform a full-load upon sync

incremental_config.Description: Specifies the maximum size (in KB) to devote to incremental config sync cached transactions. The default is 1024 KB.

network_failover.Description: Specifies if the device-group will use a network connection for failover

save_on_auto_sync.Description: Specifies whether the configuration should be saved upon auto-sync.

type.Description: Specifies if the device-group will be used for failover or resource syncing

commands.Description: The commands to send to the remote BIG-IP device over the configured provider

assignment_type.Description: Whether the specified device is a managed/un-managed/un-reachable device

bigiq_address.Description: The registration key pool to use

bigiq_login_ref.Description: Login reference for token authentication (see BIG-IQ REST docs for details)

bigiq_password.Description: The registration key pool to use

bigiq_port.Description: The registration key pool to use

bigiq_token_auth.Description: Enable to use an external authentication source (LDAP, TACACS, etc)

bigiq_user.Description: The registration key pool to use

key.Description: The registration key that you want to assign from the pool

license_poolname.Description: The registration key pool to use

mac_address.Description: Sets the rate at which this license usage is billed

skukeyword1.Description: Sets the rate at which this license usage is billed

skukeyword2.Description: Sets the rate at which this license usage is billed

tenant.Description: optional description for the assignment in this field

unit_of_measure.Description: Sets the rate at which this license usage is billed

bigip_address.Description: IP Address of BIGIP host to be used for this resource

bigip_password.Description: Password of  BIGIP host to be used for this resource

bigip_port.Description: Port number of BIGIP host to be used for this resource

bigip_token_auth.Description: Enable to use an external authentication source (LDAP, TACACS, etc)

bigip_user.Description: UserName of BIGIP host to be used for this resource

tenant_name.Deprecated: this attribute is no longer in use

md5_hash.Description: MD5 hash of the fast template zip file

source.Description: Location of the fast template set package on disk

auth_algorithm.Description: Specifies the algorithm to use for IKE authentication.

encrypt_algorithm.Description: Specifies the algorithm to use for IKE encryption.

ipcomp.Description: Specifies whether to use IPComp encapsulation.

kb_lifetime.Description: Specifies the length of time before the IKE security association expires, in kilobytes.

lifetime.Description: Specifies the length of time before the IKE security association expires, in minutes.

name.Description: Specifies the name of the IPsec policy.

perfect_forward_secrecy.Description: Specifies the Diffie-Hellman group to use for IKE Phase 2 negotiation.

tunnel_local_address.Description: Specifies the local endpoint IP address of the IPsec tunnel. This parameter is only valid when mode is tunnel.

tunnel_remote_address.Description: Specifies the remote endpoint IP address of the IPsec tunnel. This parameter is only valid when mode is tunnel.

description.Description: Specifies descriptive text that identifies the IPsec interface tunnel profile

name.Description: Displays the name of the IPsec interface tunnel profile

parent_profile.Description: Specifies the profile from which this profile inherits settings. The default is the system-supplied `/Common/ipsec` profile

traffic_selector.Description: Specifies the traffic selector for the IPsec interface tunnel to which the profile is applied

name.Description: Name of the Data Group List

type.Description: The Data Group type (string, ip, integer)

adaptive.Description: Specifies whether adaptive response time monitoring is enabled for this monitor. The default is Disabled

adaptive_limit.Description: Specifies the absolute number of milliseconds that may not be exceeded by a monitor probe, regardless of Allowed Divergence

compatibility.Description: Specifies, when enabled, that the SSL options setting (in OpenSSL) is set to ALL. The default value is enabled.

database.Description: the database in which your user is created

filename.Description: Specifies the full path and file name of the file that the system attempts to download. The health check is successful if the system can download the file.

interval.Description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when either the resource is down or the status of the resource is unknown. The default is 5

ip_dscp.Description: Displays the differentiated services code point (DSCP).The default is 0 (zero)

manual_resume.Description: Specifies whether the system automatically changes the status of a resource to Enabled at the next successful monitor check

mode.Description: Specifies the data transfer process (DTP) mode. The default value is passive.

parent.Description: Existing monitor to inherit from. Must be one of /Common/http, /Common/https, /Common/icmp or /Common/gateway_icmp.

password.Description: Specifies the password if the monitored target requires authentication

receive.Description: Specifies the regular expression representing the text string that the monitor looks for in the returned resource.

receive_disable.Description: The system marks the node or pool member disabled when its response matches Receive Disable String but not Receive String.

reverse.Description: Instructs the system to mark the target resource down when the test is successful.

send.Description: Specifies the text string that the monitor sends to the target object.

time_until_up.Description: Specifies the number of seconds to wait after a resource first responds correctly to the monitor before setting the resource to up.

timeout.Description: Specifies the number of seconds the target has in which to respond to the monitor request. The default is 16 seconds

transparent.Description: Specifies whether the monitor operates in transparent mode.

up_interval.Description: Specifies the interval for the system to use to perform the health check when a resource is up. The default is 0 (Disabled)

username.Description: Specifies the user name if the monitored target requires authentication

connection_limit.Description: Specifies the maximum number of connections allowed for the node or node address.

description.Description: User defined description of the node.

dynamic_ratio.Description: Sets the dynamic ratio number for the node. Used for dynamic ratio load balancing.

address_family.Description: Specifies the node's address family. The default is 'unspecified', or IP-agnostic

autopopulate.Description: Specifies whether the node should scale to the IP address set returned by DNS.

downinterval.Description: Specifies the number of attempts to resolve a domain name. The default is 5.

interval.Description: Specifies the amount of time before sending the next DNS query.

name.Description: Specifies the fully qualified domain name of the node.

monitor.Description: Specifies the name of the monitor or monitor rule that you want to associate with the node.

rate_limit.Description: Specifies the maximum number of connections per second allowed for a node or node address. The default value is 'disabled'.

ratio.Description: Sets the ratio number for the node.

session.Description: Enables or disables the node for new sessions. The default value is user-enabled.

state.Description: Marks the node up or down. The default value is user-up.

always_send.Description: To enable _ disable always sending cookies

cookie_encryption.Description: To required, preferred, or disabled policy for cookie encryption

cookie_name.Description: Name of the cookie to track persistence

expiration.Description: Expiration TTL for cookie specified in D:H:M:S or in seconds

hash_length.Description: Length of hash to apply to cookie

hash_offset.Description: Number of characters to skip in the cookie for the hash

httponly.Description: To enable _ disable sending only over http

match_across_pools.Description: To enable _ disable match across pools with given persistence record

match_across_services.Description: To enable _ disable match across services with given persistence record

match_across_virtuals.Description: To enable _ disable match across virtual servers with given persistence record

method.Description: Specifies the type of cookie processing that the system uses

override_conn_limit.Description: To enable _ disable that pool member connection limits are overridden for persisted clients. Per-virtual connection limits remain hard limits and are not overridden.

timeout.Description: Timeout for persistence of the session

mask.Description: Identify a range of source IP addresses to manage together as a single source address affinity persistent connection when connecting to the pool. Must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 mask.

match_across_pools.Description: To enable _ disable match across pools with given persistence record

match_across_services.Description: To enable _ disable match across services with given persistence record

match_across_virtuals.Description: To enable _ disable match across services with given persistence record

override_conn_limit.Description: To enable _ disable that pool member connection limits are overridden for persisted clients. Per-virtual connection limits remain hard limits and are not overridden.

timeout.Description: Timeout for persistence of the session

map_proxies.Description: To enable _ disable directs all to the same single pool member

mask.Description: Identify a range of source IP addresses to manage together as a single source address affinity persistent connection when connecting to the pool. Must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 mask.

match_across_pools.Description: To enable _ disable match across pools with given persistence record

match_across_services.Description: To enable _ disable match across services with given persistence record

match_across_virtuals.Description: To enable _ disable match across services with given persistence record

override_conn_limit.Description: To enable _ disable that pool member connection limits are overridden for persisted clients. Per-virtual connection limits remain hard limits and are not overridden.

timeout.Description: Timeout for persistence of the session

match_across_pools.Description: To enable _ disable match across pools with given persistence record

match_across_services.Description: To enable _ disable match across services with given persistence record

match_across_virtuals.Description: To enable _ disable match across services with given persistence record

override_conn_limit.Description: To enable _ disable that pool member connection limits are overridden for persisted clients. Per-virtual connection limits remain hard limits and are not overridden.

timeout.Description: Timeout for persistence of the session

allow_nat.Description: Specifies whether NATs are automatically enabled or disabled for any connections using this pool.

allow_snat.Description: Specifies whether SNATs are automatically enabled or disabled for any connections using this pool.

description.Description: Specifies descriptive text that identifies the pool.

load_balancing_mode.Description: Specifies the load balancing method. The default is Round Robin.Possible values: round-robin, ...

minimum_active_members.Description: Specifies whether the system load balances traffic according to the priority number assigned to the pool member,Default Value is 0(disabled)

monitors.Description: Specifies an association between a health or performance monitor and an entire pool, rather than with individual pool members

reselect_tries.Description: Specifies the number of times the system tries to contact a new pool member after a passive failure.

service_down_action.Description: Specifies how the system should respond when the target pool member becomes unavailable. The default is None, Possible values: [none, reset, reselect, drop]

slow_ramp_time.Description: Specifies the duration during which the system sends less traffic to a newly-enabled pool member.

connection_limit.Description: Specifies a maximum established connection limit for a pool member or node. When the current connections count reaches this number, the system does not send additional connections to that pool member or node. The default is 0, meaning that there is no limit to the number of connections. When used with the weighted least connections load balancing methods, the system uses connection limits to determine the proportional load of each pool member or node. This must be a value other than 0 when specified for the weighted least connections load balancing methods

connection_rate_limit.Description: Specifies the maximum number of connections-per-second allowed for a pool member. When the number of connections-per-second reaches the limit for a given pool member, the system drops (UDP) or resets (TCP) additional connection requests. This helps detect Denial of Service attacks, where connection requests flood a pool member. Setting this to 0 turns off connection limits. The default is 0.

dynamic_ratio.Description: Sets the dynamic ratio number for the node. Used for dynamic ratio load balancing.

fqdn_autopopulate.Description: Specifies whether the node should scale to the IP address set returned by DNS.

node.Description: Poolmember to add/remove to/from the pool. Format node_address:port. e.g 1.1.1.1:80

pool.Description: Name of the pool to be attached with pool members

priority_group.Description: Specifies a number representing the priority group for the pool member. The default is 0, meaning that the member has no priority. To specify a priority, you must activate priority group usage when you create a new pool or when adding or removing pool members. When activated, the system load balances traffic according to the priority group number assigned to the pool member. The higher the number, the higher the priority, so a member with a priority of 3 has higher priority than a member with a priority of 1.

ratio.Description: Specifies the ratio weight to assign to the pool member. Valid values range from 1 through 65535. The default is 1, which means that each pool member has an equal ratio proportion.

authenticate.Description: Server authentication once / always (default is once).

authenticate_depth.Description: Client certificate chain traversal depth.  Default 9.

c3d_drop_unknown_ocsp_status.Description: Unknown OCSP Response Control. Default Drop.

ca_file.Description: Client certificate file path.  Default None.

cert_extension_includes.Description: Cert extension includes for ssl forward proxy

cert_life_span.Description: Life span of the certificate in days for ssl forward proxy

cert_lookup_by_ipaddr_port.Description: Cert lookup by ip address and port enabled / disabled

defaults_from.Description: Profile name that this profile defaults from.

forward_proxy_bypass_default_action.Description: Forward proxy bypass default action. (enabled / disabled)

key.Description: Name of the Server SSL profile key

mod_ssl_methods.Description: ModSSL Methods enabled / disabled.  Default is disabled.

mode.Description: ModSSL Methods enabled / disabled.  Default is disabled.

passphrase.Description: Client Certificate Constrained Delegation CA passphrase

proxy_ssl.Description: Proxy SSL enabled / disabled.  Default is disabled.

proxy_ssl_passthrough.Description: Proxy SSL passthrough enabled / disabled.  Default is disabled.

ssl_c3d.Description: Client Certificate Constrained Delegation enabled / disabled.  Default is disabled.

ssl_sign_hash.Description: SSL sign hash (any, sha1, sha256, sha384)

client_timeout.Description: Number of seconds allowed for a client to transmit enough data to select a server when you have late binding enabled. Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

idle_timeout.Description: Number of seconds (default 300; may not be 0) connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion. Value -1 (not recommended) means infinite

allow_active_mode.Description: Specifies, when selected (enabled), that the system allows FTP Active Transfer mode. The default value is enabled.

app_service.Description: The application service to which the object belongs.

enforce_tlssession_reuse.Description: Specifies, when selected (enabled), that the system enforces the data connection to reuse a TLS session. The default value is unchecked (disabled).

inherit_parent_profile.Description: Enables the FTP data channel to inherit the TCP profile used by the control channel.If disabled,the data channel uses FastL4 only.

log_profile.Description: Configures the ALG log profile that controls logging

log_publisher.Description: Configures the log publisher that handles events logging for this profile

port.Description: Specifies a service for the data channel port used for this FTP profile. The default port is ftp-data.

security.Description: Enables secure FTP traffic for the BIG-IP Application Security Manager. You can set the security option only if the system is licensed for the BIG-IP Application Security Manager. The default value is disabled.

translate_extended.Description: This setting is enabled by default, and thus, automatically translates RFC 2428 extended requests EPSV and EPRT to PASV and PORT when communicating with IPv4 servers.

accept_xff.Description: Enables or disables trusting the client IP address, and statistics from the client IP address, based on the request's XFF (X-forwarded-for) headers, if they exist.

app_service.Description: The application service to which the object belongs.

basic_auth_realm.Description: Specifies a quoted string for the basic authentication realm. The system sends this string to a client whenever authorization fails. The default value is none

encrypt_cookie_secret.Description: Specifies a passphrase for the cookie encryption

encrypt_cookies.Description: Encrypts specified cookies that the BIG-IP system sends to a client system

fallback_host.Description: Specifies an HTTP fallback host. HTTP redirection allows you to redirect HTTP traffic to another protocol identifier, host name, port number, or URI path.

fallback_status_codes.Description: Specifies one or more three-digit status codes that can be returned by an HTTP server,that should trigger a redirection to the fallback host

head_erase.Description: Specifies the header string that you want to erase from an HTTP request. Default is none

head_insert.Description: Specifies a quoted header string that you want to insert into an HTTP request. Default is none

insert_xforwarded_for.Description: Specifies, when enabled, that the system inserts an X-Forwarded-For header in an HTTP request with the client IP address, to use with connection pooling. The default is Disabled.

lws_separator.Description: Specifies the linear white space (LWS) separator that the system inserts when a header exceeds the maximum width you specify in the LWS Maximum Columns setting.

lws_width.Description: Specifies the maximum column width for any given line, when inserting an HTTP header in an HTTP request. The default is 80

oneconnect_transformations.Description: Enables the system to perform HTTP header transformations for the purpose of keeping server-side connections open. This feature requires configuration of a OneConnect profile.

proxy_type.Description: Specifies the proxy mode for this profile: reverse, explicit, or transparent. The default is Reverse.

redirect_rewrite.Description: Specifies whether the system rewrites the URIs that are part of HTTP redirect (3XX) responses. The default is None

request_chunking.Description: Specifies how the system handles HTTP content that is chunked by a client. The default is Preserve

response_chunking.Description: Specifies how the system handles HTTP content that is chunked by a server. The default is Selective

response_headers_permitted.Description: Specifies headers that the BIG-IP system allows in an HTTP response.If you are specifying more than one header, separate the headers with a blank space

server_agent_name.Description: Specifies the value of the Server header in responses that the BIG-IP itself generates. The default is BigIP. If no string is specified, then no Server header will be added to such responses

tm_partition.Description: Displays the administrative partition within which this profile resides.

via_host_name.Description: Specifies the hostname to include into Via header

via_request.Description: Specifies whether to append, remove, or preserve a Via header in an HTTP request

via_response.Description: Specifies whether to append, remove, or preserve a Via header in an HTTP request

xff_alternative_names.Description: Specifies alternative XFF headers instead of the default X-forwarded-for header

activation_modes.Description: Specifies whether to enable all HTTP/2 modes, or only enable the Selected Modes listed in the Enabled column

concurrent_streams_per_connection.Description: Specifies the number of outstanding concurrent requests that are allowed on a single HTTP/2 connection. The default is 10

connection_idle_timeout.Description: Specifies the number of seconds that an HTTP/2 connection is idly left open before being shut down. The default is 300 seconds

enforce_tls_requirements.Description: Enable or disable enforcement of TLS requirements,Default:enabled

frame_size.Description: The size of the data frames, in bytes, that the HTTP/2 protocol sends to the client. Default: 2048

header_table_size.Description: The size of the header table, in KB, for the HTTP headers that the HTTP/2 protocol compresses to save bandwidth.Default: 4096

include_content_length.Description: Enable to include content-length in HTTP/2 headers,Default : disabled

insert_header.Description: Specifies whether an HTTP header indicating the use of HTTP/2 should be inserted into the request that goes to the server. The default value is Disabled

insert_header_name.Description: Specifies the name of the HTTP header controlled by Insert Header. The default X-HTTP2.

receive_window.Description: The flow-control size for upload streams, in KB. Default: 32

write_size.Description: The total size of combined data frames, in bytes, that the HTTP/2 protocol sends in a single write function. Default: 16384

content_type_exclude.Description: Specifies a list of content types for compression of HTTP Content-Type responses. Use a string list to specify a list of content types you want to exclude.

content_type_include.Description: Specifies a list of content types for compression of HTTP Content-Type responses. Use a string list to specify a list of content types you want to compress.

idle_timeout_override.Description: idleTimeoutOverride can be enabled or disabled

limit_type.Description: Controls how connection limits are enforced in conjunction with OneConnect. The default is None. Supported Values: [None,idle,strict]

max_age.Description: max_age has integer value typical 3600 sec

max_reuse.Description: max_reuse has integer value typical 1000 sec

max_size.Description: max_size has integer value typical 1000 sec

share_pools.Description: sharePools can be enabled or disabled

authenticate.Description: Server authentication once / always (default is once).

authenticate_depth.Description: Client certificate chain traversal depth.  Default 9.

c3d_cert_extension_includes.Description: Certificate Extensions Includes. Default Extensions List

ca_file.Description: Client certificate file path.  Default None.

defaults_from.Description: Profile name that this profile defaults from.

expire_cert_response_control.Description: Response if the cert is expired (drop / ignore).

key.Description: Name of the Serer SSL profile key

mod_ssl_methods.Description: ModSSL Methods enabled / disabled.  Default is disabled.

mode.Description: ModSSL Methods enabled / disabled.  Default is disabled.

passphrase.Description: Client Certificate Constrained Delegation CA passphrase

proxy_ssl.Description: Proxy SSL enabled / disabled.  Default is disabled.

ssl_c3d.Description: Client Certificate Constrained Delegation. Default disabled

ssl_sign_hash.Description: SSL sign hash (any, sha1, sha256, sha384)

close_wait_timeout.Description: Number of seconds (default 5) connection will remain in LAST-ACK state before exiting. Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

deferred_accept.Description: If enabled, ADC will defer allocating resources to a connection until some payload data has arrived from the client (default false). This may help minimize the impact of certain DoS attacks but adds undesirable latency under normal conditions. Note: deferredAccept is incompatible with server-speaks-first application protocols,Default : disabled

fast_open.Description: If enabled (default), the system can use the TCP Fast Open protocol extension to reduce latency by sending payload data with initial SYN

finwait_2timeout.Description: Number of seconds (default 300) connection will remain in LAST-ACK state before closing. Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

finwait_timeout.Description: Number of seconds (default 5) connection will remain in FIN-WAIT-1 or closing state before exiting. Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

idle_timeout.Description: Number of seconds (default 300; may not be 0) connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion. Value -1 (not recommended) means infinite

keepalive_interval.Description: Number of seconds (default 1800) between keep-alive probes

autolasthop.Description: Specifies whether to automatically map last hop for pools or not. The default is to use next level's defaul

mirror.Description: Enables or disables mirroring of SNAT connections.

origins.Description: Specifies, for each SNAT that you create, the origin addresses that are to be members of that SNAT. Specify origin addresses by their IP addresses and service ports

partition.Description: Partition or path to which the SNAT belongs

snatpool.Description: Specifies an existing SNAT pool to which you want to map the client IP address. When you select SNAT Pool, you also select an existing SNAT pool from the associated list.

sourceport.Description: Specifies how the SNAT object handles the client's source port. The default is Preserve.

translation.Description: Specifies a particular IP address that you want the SNAT to use as a translation address. When you select IP Address, you also type the IP address in the associated text box

vlans.Description: Specifies the VLANs or tunnels for which the SNAT is enabled or disabled. The default is All

vlansdisabled.Description: Disables the SNAT on all VLANs.

members.Description: Specifies a translation address to add to or delete from a SNAT pool, at least one address is required.

name.Description: SNAT Pool list Name, format /partition/name. e.g. /Common/snat_pool

advertize_route.Description: Enabled dynamic routing of the address

arp.Description: Enable or disable ARP for the virtual address

auto_delete.Description: Automatically delete the virtual address with the virtual server

conn_limit.Description: Max number of connections for virtual address

enabled.Description: Enable or disable the virtual address

icmp_echo.Description: Enable/Disable ICMP response to the virtual address

traffic_group.Description: Specify the partition and traffic group

pool.Description: Default pool for this virtual server

port.Description: Listen port for the virtual server

snatpool.Description: Name of the snatpool to use. Requires source_address_translation to be set to 'snat'.

source.Description: Source IP and mask for the virtual server

state.Description: Specifies whether the virtual server and its resources are available for load balancing. The default is Enabled

vlans_enabled.Description: Enables the virtual server on the VLANs specified by the VLANs option. By default it is set to false

app_service.Description: The application service that the object belongs to

ca_cert_file.Description: the trusted root and intermediate certificate authorities

crl_file.Description: Specifies the file name of the Certificate Revocation List. Only supported in IKEv1

dpd_delay.Description: Specifies the number of seconds between Dead Peer Detection messages

generate_policy.Description: Enable or disable the generation of Security Policy Database entries(SPD) when the device is the responder of the IKE remote node

lifetime.Description: Defines the lifetime in minutes of an IKE SA which will be proposed in the phase 1 negotiations

mode.Description: Defines the exchange mode for phase 1 when racoon is the initiator, or the acceptable exchange mode when racoon is the responder

my_cert_file.Description: Specifies the name of the certificate file object

my_cert_key_file.Description: Specifies the name of the certificate key file object

my_cert_key_passphrase.Description: Specifies the passphrase of the key used for my-cert-key-file

my_id_type.Description: Specifies the identifier type sent to the remote host to use in the phase 1 negotiation

my_id_value.Description: Specifies the identifier value sent to the remote host in the phase 1 negotiation

nat_traversal.Description: Enables use of the NAT-Traversal IPsec extension

passive.Description: Specifies whether the local IKE agent can be the initiator of the IKE negotiation with this ike-peer

peers_cert_file.Description: Specifies the peers certificate for authentication

peers_cert_type.Description: Specifies that the only peers-cert-type supported is certfile

peers_id_type.Description: Specifies which of address, fqdn, asn1dn, user-fqdn or keyid-tag types to use as peers-id-type

peers_id_value.Description: Specifies the peers identifier to be received

phase1_auth_method.Description: Specifies the authentication method used for phase 1 negotiation

phase1_encrypt_algorithm.Description: Specifies the encryption algorithm used for the isakmp phase 1 negotiation

phase1_hash_algorithm.Description: Defines the hash algorithm used for the isakmp phase 1 negotiation

phase1_perfect_forward_secrecy.Description: Defines the Diffie-Hellman group for key exchange to provide perfect forward secrecy

preshared_key.Description: Specifies the preshared key for ISAKMP SAs

preshared_key_encrypted.Description: Display the encrypted preshared-key for the IKE remote node

prf.Description: Specifies the pseudo-random function used to derive keying material for all cryptographic operations

proxy_support.Description: If this value is enabled, both values of ID payloads in the phase 2 exchange are used as the addresses of end-point of IPsec-SAs

remote_address.Description: Specifies the IP address of the IKE remote node

replay_window_size.Description: Specifies the replay window size of the IPsec SAs negotiated with the IKE remote node

state.Description: Enables or disables this IKE remote node

traffic_selector.Description: Specifies the names of the traffic-selector objects associated with this ike-peer

verify_cert.Description: Specifies whether to verify the certificate chain of the remote peer based on the trusted certificates in ca-cert-file

version.Description: Specifies which version of IKE to be used

traffic_group.Description: Name of the traffic group, defaults to traffic-group-local-only if not specified

app_service.Description: The application service that the object belongs to

auto_last_hop.Description: Specifies whether auto lasthop is enabled or not

idle_timeout.Description: Specifies an idle timeout for wildcard tunnels in seconds

key.Description: The key field may represent different values depending on the type of the tunnel

local_address.Description: Specifies a local IP address. This option is required

mode.Description: Specifies how the tunnel carries traffic

mtu.Description: Specifies the maximum transmission unit (MTU) of the tunnel

partition.Description: Displays the admin-partition within which this component resides

profile.Description: Specifies the profile that you want to associate with the tunnel

secondary_address.Description: Specifies a secondary non-floating IP address when the local-address is set to a floating address

tos.Description: Specifies a value for insertion into the Type of Service (ToS) octet within the IP header of the encapsulating header of transmitted packets

traffic_group.Description: Specifies a traffic-group for use with the tunnel

transparent.Description: Enables or disables the tunnel to be transparent

use_pmtu.Description: Enables or disables the tunnel to use the PMTU (Path MTU) information provided by ICMP NeedFrag error messages

full_path.Description: Full Path Name of ssl certificate

name.Description: Name of SSL Certificate with .crt extension

content.Description: Content of SSL certificate key present on local Disk

full_path.Description: Full Path Name of ssl key

name.Description: Name of SSL Certificate key with .key extension

command.Description: Tmsh command to execute tmsh commands like install

registration_key.Description: A unique Key F5 provides for Licensing BIG-IP

description.Description: Address of the Iapp which needs to be Iappensed

jsonfile.Description: Address of the Iapp which needs to be Iappensed

name.Description: Address of the Iapp which needs to be Iappensed

partition.Description: Address of the Iapp which needs to be Iappensed

cpu_ratio.Description: Use this option only when the level option is set to custom.F5 Networks recommends that you do not modify this option. The default value is none

disk_ratio.Description: Use this option only when the level option is set to custom.F5 Networks recommends that you do not modify this option. The default value is none

level.Description: Sets the provisioning level for the requested modules. Changing the level for one module may require modifying the level of another module. For example, changing one module to dedicated requires setting all others to none. Setting the level of a module to none means the module is not activated.

memory_ratio.Description: Use this option only when the level option is set to custom.F5 Networks recommends that you do not modify this option. The default value is none

name.Description: Name of module to provision in BIG-IP.

auth_protocol.Description: Specifies the protocol used to authenticate the user.

community.Description: Specifies the community string used for this trap.

engine_id.Description: Specifies the authoritative security engine for SNMPv3.

host.Description: The host the trap will be sent to.

port.Description: The port that the trap will be sent to.

privacy_password.Description: Specifies the clear text password used to encrypt traffic. This field will not be displayed.

privacy_password_encrypted.Description: Specifies the encrypted password used to encrypt traffic.

privacy_protocol.Description: Specifies the protocol used to encrypt traffic.

security_level.Description: Specifies whether or not traffic is encrypted and whether or not authentication is required.

security_name.Description: Security name used in conjunction with SNMPv3.

version.Description: SNMP version used for sending the trap.

destination_address.Description: Specifies the host or network IP address to which the application traffic is destined.When creating a new traffic selector, this parameter is required

destination_port.Description: Specifies the IP port used by the application. The default value is All Ports

direction.Description: Specifies whether the traffic selector applies to inbound or outbound traffic, or both. The default value is Both.

ip_protocol.Description: Specifies the network protocol to use for this traffic. The default value is All Protocols (255)

ipsec_policy.Description: Specifies the IPsec policy that tells the BIG-IP system how to handle the packets.When creating a new traffic selector, if this parameter is not specified, the default is default-ipsec-policy.

name.Description: Specifies the name of the traffic selector

order.Description: Specifies the order in which traffic is matched, if traffic can be matched to multiple traffic selectors.Traffic is matched to the traffic selector with the highest priority (lowest order number).When creating a new traffic selector, if this parameter is not specified, the default is last.

source_address.Description: Specifies the host or network IP address from which the application traffic originates.When creating a new traffic selector, this parameter is required.

source_port.Description: Specifies the IP port used by the application. The default value is All Ports

name.Description: Name of the Data Group List

type.Description: The Data Group type (string, ip, integer)

database.Description: the database in which your user is created

defaults_from.Description: Existing monitor to inherit from. Must be one of /Common/http, /Common/https, /Common/icmp or /Common/gateway-icmp.

filename.Description: Specifies the full path and file name of the file that the system attempts to download. The health check is successful if the system can download the file.

mode.Description: Specifies the data transfer process (DTP) mode. The default value is passive.

username.Description: Specifies the user name if the monitored target requires authentication

address.Description: IP address of the node of the node.

description.Description: User defined description of the node.

dynamic_ratio.Description: The dynamic ratio number for the node.

autopopulate.Description: Specifies if the node should scale to the IP address set returned by DNS.

downinterval.Description: The number of attempts to resolve a domain name.

interval.Description: The amount of time before sending the next DNS query.

name.Description: The fully qualified domain name of the node.

full_path.Description: Full path of the node (partition and name)

monitor.Description: Specifies the health monitors the system currently uses to monitor this node.

session.Description: Enables or disables the node for new sessions.

state.Description: The current state of the node.

bigip_gw_ip.Description: IP address of BIGIP GW to vwan will establish tunnel

vwan_gw_address.Description: IP address of vWAN GW  that will establish tunnel
